title: Method Mastery
story: Strings come with built-in superpowers called methods! These methods let you transform text in amazing ways. You can change case, find substrings, replace text, and much more. Time to unlock these abilities!
instructions: Create a variable `message` with value "python is amazing". Create `uppercase` using the upper() method, `capitalized` using the capitalize() method, and `word_count` with the number of words (3). Print all three results.
solutionHidden:
message = "python is amazing"
uppercase = message.upper()
capitalized = message.capitalize()
word_count = 3
print(uppercase)
print(capitalized)
print(word_count)

tests.expectedBehavior: Count the words in the message
Output should show uppercase, capitalized, and count
tests.expected:
PYTHON IS AMAZING
Python is amazing
3

hints.text: String methods are called with dot notation: string_var.method_name()
The upper() method converts all letters to uppercase, capitalize() makes first letter uppercase
